comments.body: Yeah, I understand once I start populating data into the console. But do you know how I can access that data with a token?

answers.body:
Using pandas you can parse a json using

df = pd.DataFrame(response)

comments.body: Thanks for the response. How do I find out what these parameters are though? The vendor has only provided a link and a key.
Normally it should give you the parameters and their types if the link has required params. maybe Web Scraping will help you to found the parameters
This is the link: support.safetyculture.com/integrations/… maybe you will have more experience than me in distinguishing next steps after I am able to connect.
@Arthur this is going to help you make any request on their API and you can found all the possible parameters. Hope it help you thanks.

answers.body:
Yes @Arthur there is a way to call an end point with multiple parameters

you could do like here by adding params option in your requests like

response = requests.get('https://website.com', params={'key1': 'value1', 'key2': 'value2'}, headers= {'Authorization': 'key'})

then using pandas you can get your dataFrame like

df = pd.DataFrame.from_dict(response.json(), orient='columns')

For your self-learn you can have a look at here it will help you handle any API call

and to setup your own API's here is the good place to start if you love Django

Please let me know if it helps.

title: How to find out the parameters in an API using Python
body:
Below is the code I have:

response = requests.get('https://website.com', headers= {'Authorization': 'key'})

The response I get is 200. So obviously that is good.

I am trying to pull data and format them into data frames afterwards. How do I move forward after this line of code? I don't know what parameters (I think that is the term) to put after because the vendor is very unresponsive and just gave me this link and key.

Is there a way to call for a list of the parameters?
